title: Bake Off's Steph cries as souffles fail to rise in 2019 final technical
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The Great British Bake Off 2019 finalist Steph Blackwell broke down into tears during tonight’s final after her souffles fell apart.

The 28-year-old contestant welled up as she realised she’d accidentally put cold water in the water bath rather than warm, which therefore prevented her bakes from cooking in the oven.

‘This is a bit embarrassing really, isn’t it?’ Steph said as she noticed her technical begin to fail.

‘Oh dear, pray for me. I mean, do we keep going?’

As Steph accepted that the souffles weren’t going to come out how she wanted, she cried and admitted to the cameras: ‘I just feel a bit stupid. It couldn’t have gone much worse, could it?’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith didn’t hold back their thoughts on the culinary disaster either, branding the botched dish ‘soups’ and ‘pancakes’.

Steph cried during the final of Bake Off (Picture: Channel 4)

Oh no! Disaster strikes for poor Steph. #GBBOFinal pic.twitter.com/zvvKtYskp2 — British Bake Off (@BritishBakeOff) October 29, 2019

Steph’s souffles didn’t turn out how she’d hoped (Picture: Channel 4)

‘The biscuits are too thick,’ observed Paul. ‘That’s hardly been in the oven, look. They’ve had problems with the souffle from the start.

‘They’ve beaten the whole thing to death.’

Prue wasn’t so harsh though, adding: ‘Because those ingredients are so delicious, it tastes lovely. It’s like eating a sauce.’

As a result of Steph’s nightmare mishap, she placed third, behind her competitors Alice and David.

‘I’m so sorry,’ she told Prue and Paul.

Viewers were also in bits at Steph’s soggy souffles, with one writing on Twitter: ‘When Steph cried because her soufflés didn’t rise. It took a lot of strength to not cry with her.’

Echoing a similar sentiment, another added: ‘Not gonna lie but I just let out a little tear for Steph with her souffles.’

The Great British Bake Off is available for catch-up on 4OD.

description: The Great British Bake Off's Steph cries as souffles fail to rise in disastrous final technical.
